dialog: That seems fair, wizard.
Are you not Jim Green, the wizard?
Yes, I am Jim Green. Verily, it is I.
I recall our meeting at a wizarding concert last year. I am Taylor, wizard of renown.
Ah, yes, I remember now. Greetings, Taylor.
Lucy, I wish to attend to the flickering light in the corridor, which hath been driving me mad. Would thou art willing to aid me with thy ladder?
Monica, tarry for a moment. I think it would be best to summon a repair wizard to attend to the task.
I am confident that I can handle it alone.
I would like thee to peruse the safety manual of our wizarding company.
I comprehend. If I were to be injured whilst fixing the light, even during office hours, I would not receive compensation from our wizarding company, as repairing is not my responsibility.
Other wizarding company regulations also require your attention.
Like this one? Never wear loose robes or untied hair when operating the shredder. Aye, thank thee for thy warning.
Do not mention it, wizard.
Huzzah! I have completed writing the service guide! It hath taken me an age!
When didst thou complete the task?
This morning! No more overtime, and no more headaches!
Well, I am glad to hear it. Wouldst thou care for a cup of wizarding coffee?
I did not receive an unemployment stipend this week and must know the reason why.
Didst thou send us thy last Continued Claim Form, wizard?
I fear I may have forgotten to send it in.
